page.title: 17WETHERBY SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: At the beginning of the 1984-85 school year, Wetherby High School had 1163 pupils and 76 members of staff, giving a pupil/teacher ratio of 15.4. The first three years are an introduction to the 23 subjects offered, from which pupils choose 8 to study in the 4th and 5th years to either GCE Ordinary level, 16+ or CSE standard, depending upon their ability. From 1986, however, these will be replaced by one GCSE course in each subject. The 6th form currently offers over 20 subjects, at GCE Advanced level, from which pupils normally choose 3. Other courses are available, including pre- vocational BTEC, City and Guilds Foundation and life, social skills and community involvement courses. In the future, "A"level students will also have to study two "AS" subjects.
